review: absolute peak sat down to play out of curiosity then suddenly had 50 hours on it  i am somewhat bias for the setting since i love underground stuff  minor issues with selecting tiles during combat on high res but manageable   in general just really fun
very addictive game easy to catch up with almost everything character development is excellent and just about enough map is easy to go through i would grade it 910
good game

just finished the game most big modern rpgs trending to dip in quality somewhere after act 2 this one despite dated presentation kept me hooked no addicted to the very end had no need for any guides it was a bit hard at times but very satisfying loved the writing light engaging fun   loved this game instant classic to me
well i played a bit but the quests and dialogues are boring and lack depth and overall its not a fun game i am sorry i really wanted to like it but its not my cup of tea
its like the old school ultima games without the jank worth a play
i remember playing these games back when i first started gaming the old school vibe takes a bit to get into but when you do its very immersive combat is basic but funand the writing is excellent

cons  ui is clunky from the early 2000s  which makes the combat clunky switching between mouse and keyboard letters pros awesome openworld rpg that i would qualify as elder scrolls with topdown bad graphics  there is something very unique to this games world and writing
im only 26 hours in but its a good old school rpg with a good story

do you like early rpgs with a good sense of silly humor mixed with deep complex systems and a good tutorial how about interesting building blocks many other games have used since the release of this series well then get this series and enjoy yourself alot of fun times
great old school crpg combat isnt particularly complex but it more than makes up for it with story and world building
a good blend of old school crpg and being a game a person can play and enjoy
havent progressed past character creation
2nd spiderweb game ive finished after playing the entire geneforge series and only actually finishing the last game very simple and intuitive progression

always a good time playing anything from these devs  the qol and modern bells  whistles arent there and none of your party members are really characters that you can develop in any meaningful way but the writing and worldbuilding is without equal  go in knowing that and youll find a lot to enjoy here

fans of classic crpg games should buy this immediately  a word of warning though the game doesnt really like 4k tvs so if you play on one you will have to drop the resolution otherwise you wont be able to see text
decent little putz about game read the tags on the store its got those things xd
amazing charming game writing is surprisingly good the world is interesting and well crafted  if you can get pass the graphics its a great rpg
great rpg
great rpg adventure from the past remastered and made to work on modern systems if you like a good story and adventure you should check out this series and the other spiderweb software titles
good remake but i miss the wall bumping
been playing since it was called exileescape from the pit will always love these games its an old school turn based rpg and itll always have a special place to me

such a great underappreciated game
it has less jank than youd think for something so old tech wise somehow the world and story feels very immersive which is the big appeal to it

it has some issuesspotting items on the ground the older control scheme the hp sponge enemies later in the game with several hundred hp and 70 damage reduction but otherwise is a pretty good older style dungeon crawler and it has built in cheats to help alleviate those issues if you wanna use them
i normally dont enjoy open world games but this one was fun to explore

loved these games since i was a kid playing exile iii ruined world
immersive story based off an old classic

an excelent rpg classic with good story intuitive gameplay well thought out magic and combat system no excess of loot and items  and only a handfull of epic items enjoyed all three end quests each od them a different challange for my liking a 910 rpg game dont mind the graphics remember its fantasy so imagine and use your creative mind
godly
gem of an rpg more open world than any aaa open world title

ive got every game from this developer because i wanted to support the artist i believe its one guy that being said this is the only avernum game ive ever played really   if you love rpgs with party tactics youll probably like this game it can feel a little derivative but you can feel the love that went into it i love the the phil foglio art in the skill screen legendary

this still holds up today as a great rpg its world has many quests lots of hidden secrets and items great progression system learning new spells feels soooo good and is pretty big too if youve never played a spiderweb software game i highly recommend giving this a go
5 stars

feels like an osr table top game in a lot of ways classic but modern
i like nice looking games like bg3 well enough but its nice to have a game that loads in two seconds
just your basic quest its the same quest you go on in most spiderweb games but its got a lot of cool secrets and fun character building thats it and all it really needs to be
i have bought this game 3 times and ill buy whatever remaster vogel makes next outside of nostalgia its a solid if a bit derivative world with everything one would expect from the genre

im not much of one to worry about graphics and such that being said this game is really starting to pull me in with its story  the gameplay has been fun so far i look forward to what the game will present as i continue to play
the game is very fun and you have a lot of stuff to do just remember to level up properly before you go to certain areas

simple graphics but a nice game  i like it
if nothing else this game is nostalgic i played the original many years ago and i like this updated version good rpg classic
spiderweb software games are addictive like crack
old school fun with a good level of challenge intriguing quests hidden surprises and more

ive been playing spiderweb software games since this one was called exile and just released i have never been disappointed perfect challenge level rich and robust content and a lovely sense of humour permeate every game these are good people doing good things and they deserve much support  youll get a couple boatloads of fun out of it
maybe its not skyrim or oblivion but still a vast game with much to enjoy

tight game  party of 4 adventurers assists in an uprising against authoritarian masters  challenging  ive restarted about five times fine tuning my skill points for the upcoming battle  reminiscent of some early rpgs such as ultima iv  the producer is a great guy too
610  ui needs improvement but its a decent game for a classic rpg

a basic rpg avernum escape from the pit is thus a simple rpg game to play the combat mechanics are easy to do and the game world is nice to explore with the help of a fasttravel system in the later stages of the game  other than that the lack of music and the graphical models of characters and enemies is really a disappointment still a decent game despite these faults

a classic open map adventure that has me excited to find hidden doors daunted by clever and powerful foes and constantly looking to just check one more thing off my list of places to explore and quests to complete old school crpg that just feels good to play today my only single complaint is the mouse targeting is sometimes finicky but there always seems to be a keyboard command available when i need precision so its hardly detrimental to the experience

this game is oldscool the graphics are poor but functional the sound is abysmal but the story and dialogue are good no stupid romances no politics no intercourse with animals just exploration combat and character development it is not made for modern audiences which is great it is much like a book a lot of the world is up to your imagination  its sad that such small indie games do not have the ressources for localisation i am happy i understand some english
its a good oldstyle oldschool adventure game the ui is pretty dated but the gameplay is solid and theres lots of interesting stuff to do
love this game
simple and vast solid crpg
amazing crpg with a creative world to explore it reminded me of what i love about role playing games

good game dialogue and story were good leveling after 30 was tedious with torment playthrough much time was spent finding doable stuff and healing at town but in the end well worth it skill  attribute respec would be nice since i made couple skill error with my warrior but those points didnt break the build also sometimes skilltree mechanics caused issues since it isnt possible to increase skills more than one
draws you in and doesnt want to let you go satisfying turn based combat good world building well balanced game play
closest thing to a modern ultima game ive ever played
it brings back nostalgia of playing exile escape from the pit on the good old apple computer floppy disc
its good kinda old and kinda janky but worth the hassle if you enjoy the turn based thing  710
incredible old school crpg
pretty good

this game is near perfect avernum has many of the aspects of baldurs gate that i love and very few of the things that i find annoying limited resources slow combat etc the story is great the freedom is fantastic and the game play is very enjoyable even after dozens of hours of play there are even some great elements that remind me of the early ultima games   this is truly a topnotch game
hours upon hours of fun

gamehorder seal of approval  brings me back to the days of paperdoll character sheets picking up useless objects just cause you can and that epic scale of a vast world for you to explore waiting for you awesome open ended rpg check out my lp of it on youtube httpswwwyoutubecomwatchvxrdtjqcbnrefeatureyoutube
pretty darn good looks even better after crystal souls introduced a few annoyances that seemed like it was fixing stuff that wasnt broken

i really enjoy that atmosphere and way the writing and quest feel like a table top rpg more so than other ttrpg inspired crpgs this game feels more like dd than baldurs gate or patherfinder wrath of the righteous it just has that amateur spirit that i adore and eat up great game all around
a minimalist crpg that makes for a great distraction especially for 2
old school brings back memories

recommended it took me about 2 hrs to really mesh with the ui and get into the adventure i love crpgs and find the combat and loot grinding in this game is fun the story so far is decent and have met a dragon and battled skeletons goblins fades bandits and of course rats i bought several games in this series and seems like i made the right decision
very difficult on torment  just how i like it
ive loved these games since i was young and still replay them regularly theyre idle enough that i can play them while multitasking and i love the story of this game

avernum is a game set in an underground world a prison that you can not escape from one that has built its on culture i would say like gothic but much deeper  8 hours in and sadly i have had to give up with this intersting world   the game is sadly riddled with uninteresting quests and combat if you can put up with that there does appear to be am interesting setting however i would only recommend to play if you aggressively enjoy dd crpgs
fun old school

a little more simple spell wise than other rpgs like baldurs gate but that ends up making the game very solid at its core a large interesting world to explore small secrets to uncover hidden levers and the like good combat and great story i played this game to completion and now am hunting the last few achievements  910 missing a little of the secret sauce of a 1010 but i keep coming back for more

an alltime classic if retro rpg games are your cup of tea avernum definitely satisfies this requisite the graphics and mechanics are solid and the story is pretty rich if you can endure the wall of texts that the game present but you wouldnt be playing this game if you were not looking for a oldstyle rpg from the 00

its definitely old school and not for everyone some quests can take a long time combat is turn based and the story develops slowly and the game itself can be a grind  that said i still enjoy it as i love playing these types of games
not an amazing game with enthralling mechanics or anything but definitely worth the less than 10 i paid for it and a decent little game to push around when you want to put in low effort

incredibly satisfying exploration story and tactical combat this is a must have for anyone who is a fan of ultima or final fantasy i see common threads from both with a unique take in delivery the graphics and sound are dated but that is the only part of the game i would deem less than amazing

ive played these games since i found it on a shareware compilation disk in the late 90s and every time around im surprised at how fun it is there is just enough new to keep me coming back it does feel a little more streamlined with each iteration if you havent played any of these games before youre in for a treat dont obsess over minmaxing just enjoy the unique detailed and sometimes goofy world
great story good alternative to book reading
relive the good old days of computer rpgs very fun and brings back lots of great memories can you do better then you did before try again

fantastic old school crpg  story is there but mostly world building and feels very much like a dd campaign combat is interesting and diverse but has plenty of weird jank both beneficial and frustrating and there are plenty of groan worthy quests that are such a pain to get through but never make you want to stop playing for some reason worth checking out if youre a fan of old school turn based dungeon slogging
simple and effective

i love this game yeah its kinda ugly and the sounds are basicand spiderweb gets every millimeter of mileage out of these assets truly fantastic environmental storytelling as well as writing i wish vogel had a aaa budget
generally if you like one spiderweb game youll like the rest good rpgs in the classical sense without feeling dated i enjoy them
i grew up playing the old exile series shareware games on mac and the fact that remakes exist makes me so happy
it was better when it was exile and you could have 6 party members still a great game with a good story
love this game  great story i love coming back to it every few years when i forgot most of it  favorite quote optimistic to the last and stupid also very stupid

it took 2 tries to get into and commit to this behemoth of a game the controls are clunky the graphics are dated and the balancing of battles will have you frequently switching between normal and hard but if you can look past the rough edges youll find a gem of a compelling and novel story interesting characters and an underground world thatll reward you for exploring every nook and cranny  8510

this is a great oldschool rpg with plenty of interesting storylines and quests to pursue it does get quite difficult on harder settings so it can be a good challenge if thats what youre in the mood for
a fantastic oldschool rpg just about the only thing that would make it better would be scroll bars that work with the mouse wheel
old but gold a nice surprise
excellent old school rpg  uses a point based system
absorbing and old school  vg

a remake of a remake done quite well the mechanics are simple the quests are simple but the turnbased combat is solid enough to carry it along the world map exploration does a great job of making you feel like you are exploring a gigantic cave system no real moral quandaries just a simple rpg with a neat premise well worth the price of admission

avernum or exile when i first played it has an inspired setting great dialogue and storytelling and fun combat i played the whole game and finished all the win conditions just so i could get the full story of the game and thats rare nowadays to have given that much of a care about this game means that spiderweb software is still killin it  pick this game up and give it a shot if you complete it and love it just buy the whole series the story just gets better in the next two games
play this game avernum has some of the most engaging narrative and world building of any rpg ive played the environments feel alive the npcs have convincing problems and choices matter go
nostalgic clever charming oldtimey rpg
come for the spiderweb reputation stay for the great writing eventually leave for the annoying background voice in certain towns that says mommyyyyy in a whiny monotone  810

as a modern rpg player this game is exactly what it says on the tin it doesnt lead you around by the nose but its not opaque either its best parts are its elegant simplicity of the game mechanics and its worst are just bits and pieces of polish and design that the game doesnt have for obvious chronological reasons

mr vogels game is a masterpiece i played it original as exile escape from the pit and while it was nothing impressive to look in it had a deep story and expansive world and a simple yet challenging combat  9510 would have been 1110 if it had dinosaurs that you could name
this game is amazing cant believe it took me this long to play it
amazing classic turnbased rpg its difficult its challenging and theres no handholding this aint your nephews rpg its your uncles
yes if you were lucky enough to stumble on this game in the store the answer is yes fun yes challenging yes cheats yes buy it yes yes
party rpg low graphics but fun turnbased fighting great and cheap sale
i love the alone against the world kind of vibe i get from this game

if youre a fan of oldschool rpgs and dont care about voice acting or fancy graphics or any of the fancy bells and whistles to expect from a more modern game this and i assume the rest in the seriesfrom the publisher is a pretty enjoyable game i get frustrated on occasion but thats more because im not very good at it than any fault of the games
